title: Why do some music CD's not play on computer, but play on music players? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1. There are cds which are write/ copy protected and made only for music players. 2. Another case could be if it is corrupt and computer not able to detect. 3. If everything is fine then your music player does not support the file format or no available audio codecs installed on it. Ex: aar, aac, m4a, ogg,wav.Regular ones are mp3, raw wav, wma formats.4. To try playing in windows media player on a computer you can rip the cd and copy songs to your machine. Rip wi help you copy songs to folder as wma or mp3 file on your machine. 5. Alternatively you can insert cd and use iTunes to import songs from cd and rip.
